title: Alex Katz: Six Ramps of a Painter’s Progress
description: His eight-decade retrospective at the Guggenheim is a dazzling matchup of singular artworks — some fresh from the studio — and celebrated spiral.
dc:creator: Roberta Smith
media:credit: Alex Katz/Licensed by VAGA at Artists Rights Society (ARS), NY; George Etheredge for The New York Times
media:description: Installation view of “Alex Katz: Gathering” at the Guggenheim Museum, showing Katz’s oil-on-aluminum cutout, “Jack and D.D. Ryan” in the foreground. Left, his paintings “Ted Berrigan” (1967); center, “Scott and John” (1966); right, “Ada and Vincent” (1967).
